metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10033 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The mailSend function in the isMail transport in PHPMailer before 5.2.18 might allow remote attackers to pass extra parameters to the mail command and consequently execute arbitrary code via a \" (backslash double quote) in a crafted Sender property.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10033` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libphp-phpmailer - 5.2.14+dfsg-2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> applying the patch to this CVE introduces a new vulnerability, the one related to CVE-2016-10045. Therefore, when patching this CVE, also apply the fix for CVE-2016-10045.

criterions.comment: libphp-phpmailer package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.14+dfsg-2.1').
